message:
the JavaScript version of Xamarin :)
JavaScript is ruling the world
story: Ahmed Mozaly shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Announcing Telerik NativeScript - cross-platform framework for building native mobile applications
caption: blogs.telerik.com
description: Telerik NativeScript - cross-platform framework for building native mobile applications

data.message: Is it free? I doubt it as Telerik tools have always been super duper expensive :v

Xamarin is not that too affordable thing also, they will open source NativeScript Framework, and if NativeScript will be part of Telerik platform you can get it at $40-$50 monthly, which is more affordable than Xamarin which you need three licences regularly to cover Android, IOS and Windows
Damn, oh well no one said software development is cheap, it's just that I have been spoiled by Microsoft and the free copies of Visual Studio that I used to get from my DreamSpark account :D

Guys, just go open source and forget about the word license, Also expect Ubuntu for phones to come out and you can develop on that using Python. I predict very soon we won't need these web tools to work on native paltforms.

Open Source is now the leading truck 
every new comers are offering their technology stack as open source, but trying hard to connect you to some cloud services they do, to find something they can charge you for :)

But in the end, the open source  world will always have free alternatives and with Python libraries will always exist. I predict a world free of big corp or more accurately where big corp will have no more control. They will produce some nice to haves, but that's it.
